dialogue: [Didi.] [Didi. Eat a little more.]
[Nai Nai, I don’t want it I don’t want it I don’t want -]
[What are you looking at me for.]
[I can’t look at you?]
[I’m looking at you! I’m looking at you!]
[Do you want me to bring home a bento box for lunch?] *
Mom, no. Leave. Just get out, get out, get out.
What about dinner? Will you￾
Sorry guys...my mom’s like...super annoying....
[How could you do this!? What do I always tell you? Your mouth is for saying nice words. Your hands are for doing good deeds.]
[I DON’T CARE. YOU CANNOT HIT
[DON’T SAY DIRTY WORDS!]
[Do you know how your behavior makes me look!? Like I raised a son without a single manner.]
[YOU DARE YOU SAY THAT TO ME?
[Didi.]
[Lower your voice.]
[What?]
[...Come here, Didi.]
[Do you remember when Vivian ran away when she was 14?]

[She asked me to sleepover at Annie’s house, and I didn’t let her. She got so mad at me. I still remember she looked at me and said, Mom,] I just want you to know that I hate you...I feel so hurt. [And then, she ran away. She was gone for three days. I was so scared. Then, one day, she just came home. She didn’t talk to me. Wouldn’t look at me. But I was so happy...] [Compared to her, you are not as stubborn. So I knew you would come home.]

[Didi, you know. Sometimes I sit and think about how I ended up here. Just an ordinary housewife. And it is true. I do wonder sometimes...is this it? What would my life be like if I didn’t marry your father and have you and Vivian. Would I be happier? Maybe now I would be a successful artist in New York City with my own studio and gallery. I allow myself to dream. But then, as soon as I see you, I know - this is where I want to be. Didi, being your mother is really difficult, but getting to watch you and Vivian grow up here, make friends, and learn so many things I can’t teach you, I realize...you are my dream.] I’m so proud. [But with your dad not around, and Nai Nai always criticizing me for how I raise you and Vivian - sometimes it’s really too much. And sometimes I think...maybe I failed as a mother. But I know - no matter what - I must do my best to love you both. That is my duty.] But it is a little hard.
Madi?
